intro: Aporosa pseudoficifolia var. pseudoficifolia, commonly known as the Chinese hibiscus, is a deciduous shrub native to southern China. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its palmately lobed leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 2–4 meters and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional Chinese medicine. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds.
